# OAuth 2 client by Spring Boot 2

1. Run Keycloak
2. Generate access token using `OAuthClient`
3. Run class `spring.boot2.oauth2.resourceserver.ResourceServerApp`
4. Test: 
```
curl \
    -H 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCIgOiAiSldUIiwia2lkIiA6ICJsWDdoeWNnZ2hYSDY2WV96c3hSbmRXb3JwWGhVb3lLLVNscktWUTVZX0xJIn0..AqN5nOIeWkukjPc0iA8kuI7yS6yye-YT3rYtYsjQoyXwPe5VzbeXvgEoDQ6hXJsk0m9fqVt_0tZrg0onfExoJXuFKAsEQhkr-ROlsRauuoohu5yeNd5CEOPhCNx7sETFpYG9N0erR1YYf7ZpCglWH2uL5S0yJdp3Yi4VyjvG4fxYQaEWiqTY2W6vZ1h6bJrJnapKuwnET4uTS7f4pMg89vD_cpjNlwINFOBWZ5ET6abc8PODvUT61AG2xJqZeU9qqJmbq2ZzsF0XruXIllDJzop8XKcNRzSbfgDbs9kbcbTQnEFUb_8zpeA3Hb0Mypk2n39EqX5_63G-E93Y272Qnw' \
    http://localhost:8082/api/greet
```


```
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer $ADMIN_TOKEN" http://localhost:8082/api/greet
```
